conclusion: To analyze how the shadows A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves to the back right, we need to consider the direction and angle of the light relative to each object.
Shadow A (Cake) will shift to the left and slightly forward since the light is coming from the back right.
Shadow A (Cake) may appear slightly larger due to the angle of the light casting it at an oblique angle.
Shadow B (Nail) will move to the left and forward, aligning with the new light direction.
Shadow B (Nail) size may increase slightly due to the angle of the light.
Shadow C (First Aid Kit) will shift to the left and forward, similar to shadows A and B.
Shadow C (First Aid Kit) size may become larger because of the angle at which the light hits the cylindrical shape.
Shadow D (Ring) will move to the left and forward.
Shadow D (Ring) may appear more elongated and possibly larger due to the angle of the light source.
In summary, all shadows will shift to the left and forward when the light source moves to the back right.
Additionally, the shadows may appear larger due to the new angle of illumination.
Final Answer: A, B, C, and D will all shift to the left and forward. The shadows may also appear larger and more elongated.
